newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ plane slightly damaged by lightning strike.
newsitem.headline: NZ plane slightly damaged by lightning strike.

text.p: A lightning strike on an Ansett passenger jet flying into Auckland this morning damaged it slightly and put the plane out of service for several hours.
Ansett spokesman John Cordery told NZPA the lightning punched a small slit, the size of a pencil, in the aircraft's radome -- a plate covering the radar on the nose of the jet.
"No problems," Cordery said. "The aircraft are built to withstand that sort of thing."
The BAe-146 landed safely in Auckland but a replacement radome had to be flown from Christchurch and the delivery and fitting were expected to keep the aircraft on the ground until mid-afternoon.
